event.title: 2000 census, the population of the district is 41,628 of which 15,587 live

data.event: According to the 2000 census, the population of the district is 41,628 of which 15,587 live in the town of Korgan.

event.title: was occupied by Persians in the reign of Darius I in the 6th century BC

data.event: The district of Korgan has been a source of iron ore since the reign of Mithridates, King of Pontus, and even before that the area was occupied by Persians in the reign of Darius I in the 6th century BC, as part of the Satrapy of Pontus and Cappadocia.
This era ended in 1083 when Korgan was conquered by the Turkish armies of Danishmend Gazi.
Subsequently a number of Turkish tribes ruled here until 1398 when Bayezid I brought the area, then known as Ke≈üdere after a tributary of the River Bolaman, into the Ottoman Empire.
